intro: Nestegis monticola, commonly known as the mountain nestegis, is a shrub native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants such as the cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are drupes, typically containing a single seed enclosed in a hard, woody pulp. Nestegis monticola is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, elevated habitats.
